meanings.definition: Behaving in a boisterous or macho manner, typically associated with young men.
meanings.sent1: The group of boys at the party were being laddish, laughing loudly and joking around.
meanings.sent2: His laddish behavior at the football game included shouting and high-fiving his friends.
meanings.sent3: When the laddish group tried to play a prank, it ended up backfiring on them.
meanings.sent4: His laddish attitude towards challenges was like a bull charging ahead without fear.
meanings.sent5: The laddish energy in the room was palpable, making everyone feel excited and rowdy.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or resembling the behavior of a stereotypical young man.
meanings.sent1: The movie portrayed the main character as laddish, with his love for sports and competitive nature.
meanings.sent2: His choice of clothing was quite laddish, with bold colors and sporty designs.
meanings.sent3: The laddish banter between the friends always brought laughter and camaraderie.
meanings.sent4: Her laddish determination to win the race was like a force of nature, unstoppable and fierce.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with a laddish vibe, with talk of sports and friendly competition.
